performance.title: performance
performance.text: In a world where everything goes ever faster, we have lost a great deal of our patience toward the internet. The loading time of a website and the speed between interaction with it is now more important than ever. A user should never have to wait for a website while turning his thumb anymore or that might make them leave and never come back.

accessibility.title: accessibility
accessibility.text: Screens are everywhere now, almost everybody carry one with them all day. Browsers are lightweight enough to be available on almost any screen, that mean websites now need to be usable and visually appealing on all screen size and shapes. From an Iphone 5 to a 8k screen your website should display properly and give a great user experience.

visibility.title: visibility
visibility.text: SEO has evolved a lot in the recent years, google remain the giant to target but it's ranking algorithm is more complex. Social medias and quality content is taking a bigger place than ever and you should be findable on every platform. With APIs like the open graph protocol or the twitter cards we can make sure your content is sharable and visible, everywhere.

scalability.title: scalability
scalability.text: Maintaining a project on the long term is crucial and it can often get messy when you have different developper working on it over time. Taking advantage of a templating framework like Vue we develop every aspect of a site or app in an independent box also known as a component that we can test independently and make sure it's rock solid. It is very important to insure code uniformity through linter, code formatter and never forget DevOps for auto-deploys and codebase management.

serverless.title: serverless
serverless.text: Servers are expensive. Most of the time your project probably doesn't need one. With the rise of cloud functions and databases you can get the computing power that you need only when you need it and it will scale to your needs without having to manage anything. That makes you save time and money, it might even be free. But don't get me wrong big projects often need a complex backend architecture and it can be less of a headache to have a node.js server running on amazon, digital ocean, ibm, etc.
